name: okta
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing okta resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`okta` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/oktadeveloper/terraform-provider-okta).

apiToken.description: API Token granting privileges to Okta API.

backoff.description: Use exponential back off strategy for rate limits.

baseUrl.description: The Okta url. (Use 'oktapreview.com' for Okta testing)

maxRetries.description: maximum number of retries to attempt before erroring out.

maxWaitSeconds.description: maximum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

minWaitSeconds.description: minimum seconds to wait when rate limit is hit. We use exponential backoffs when backoff is enabled.

orgName.description: The organization to manage in Okta.

parallelism.description:
Number of concurrent requests to make within a resource where bulk operations are not possible. Take note of
https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/getting_started/rate-limits.

requestTimeout.description:
Timeout for single request (in seconds) which is made to Okta, the default is `0` (means no limit is set). The maximum
value can be `100`.

okta:app/groupAssignment:GroupAssignment.description:
Assigns a group to an application.

This resource allows you to create an App Group assignment.


## Import

An application group assignment can be imported via the `app_id` and the `group_id`.

```sh
 $ pulumi import okta:app/groupAssignment:GroupAssignment example <app_id>/<group_id>
```

appId.description: The ID of the application to assign a group to.

groupId.description: The ID of the group to assign the app to.

passwordDictionaryLookup.description: Check Passwords Against Common Password Dictionary.

passwordExcludeFirstName.description: User firstName attribute must be excluded from the password

passwordExcludeLastName.description: User lastName attribute must be excluded from the password

passwordExcludeUsername.description: If the user name must be excluded from the password.

passwordExpireWarnDays.description: Length in days a user will be warned before password expiry: 0 = no warning.

passwordHistoryCount.description: Number of distinct passwords that must be created before they can be reused: 0 = none.

passwordLockoutNotificationChannels.description: Notification channels to use to notify a user when their account has been locked.

passwordMaxAgeDays.description: Length in days a password is valid before expiry: 0 = no limit.

passwordMaxLockoutAttempts.description: Number of unsuccessful login attempts allowed before lockout: 0 = no limit.

passwordMinAgeMinutes.description: Minimum time interval in minutes between password changes: 0 = no limit.

passwordMinLowercase.description: If a password must contain at least one lower case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

passwordMinNumber.description: If a password must contain at least one number: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

passwordMinSymbol.description: If a password must contain at least one symbol (!@#$%^&*): 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

passwordMinUppercase.description: If a password must contain at least one upper case letter: 0 = no, 1 = yes. Default = 1

passwordShowLockoutFailures.description: If a user should be informed when their account is locked.

priority.description:
Policy Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid
priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

questionMinLength.description: Min length of the password recovery question answer.

questionRecovery.description: Enable or disable security question password recovery: ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

recoveryEmailToken.description: Lifetime in minutes of the recovery email token.

skipUnlock.description:

Windows account.

okta:idp/oidc:Oidc.description:
Creates an OIDC Identity Provider.

This resource allows you to create and configure an OIDC Identity Provider.

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as okta from "@pulumi/okta";

const example = new okta.idp.Oidc("example", {
    acsBinding: "HTTP-POST",
    acsType: "INSTANCE",
    authorizationBinding: "HTTP-REDIRECT",
    authorizationUrl: "https://idp.example.com/authorize",
    clientId: "efg456",
    clientSecret: "efg456",
    issuerUrl: "https://id.example.com",
    jwksBinding: "HTTP-REDIRECT",
    jwksUrl: "https://idp.example.com/keys",
    scopes: ["openid"],
    tokenBinding: "HTTP-POST",
    tokenUrl: "https://idp.example.com/token",
    userInfoBinding: "HTTP-REDIRECT",
    userInfoUrl: "https://idp.example.com/userinfo",
    usernameTemplate: "idpuser.email",
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_okta as okta

example = okta.idp.Oidc("example",
    acs_binding="HTTP-POST",
    acs_type="INSTANCE",
    authorization_binding="HTTP-REDIRECT",
    authorization_url="https://idp.example.com/authorize",
    client_id="efg456",
    client_secret="efg456",
    issuer_url="https://id.example.com",
    jwks_binding="HTTP-REDIRECT",
    jwks_url="https://idp.example.com/keys",
    scopes=["openid"],
    token_binding="HTTP-POST",
    token_url="https://idp.example.com/token",
    user_info_binding="HTTP-REDIRECT",
    user_info_url="https://idp.example.com/userinfo",
    username_template="idpuser.email")
```
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Okta = Pulumi.Okta;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var example = new Okta.Idp.Oidc("example", new Okta.Idp.OidcArgs
        {
            AcsBinding = "HTTP-POST",
            AcsType = "INSTANCE",
            AuthorizationBinding = "HTTP-REDIRECT",
            AuthorizationUrl = "https://idp.example.com/authorize",
            ClientId = "efg456",
            ClientSecret = "efg456",
            IssuerUrl = "https://id.example.com",
            JwksBinding = "HTTP-REDIRECT",
            JwksUrl = "https://idp.example.com/keys",
            Scopes = 
            {
                "openid",
            },
            TokenBinding = "HTTP-POST",
            TokenUrl = "https://idp.example.com/token",
            UserInfoBinding = "HTTP-REDIRECT",
            UserInfoUrl = "https://idp.example.com/userinfo",
            UsernameTemplate = "idpuser.email",
        });
    }

}
```
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-okta/sdk/v2/go/okta/idp"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := idp.NewOidc(ctx, "example", &idp.OidcArgs{
			AcsBinding:           pulumi.String("HTTP-POST"),
			AcsType:              pulumi.String("INSTANCE"),
			AuthorizationBinding: pulumi.String("HTTP-REDIRECT"),
			AuthorizationUrl:     pulumi.String("https://idp.example.com/authorize"),
			ClientId:             pulumi.String("efg456"),
			ClientSecret:         pulumi.String("efg456"),
			IssuerUrl:            pulumi.String("https://id.example.com"),
			JwksBinding:          pulumi.String("HTTP-REDIRECT"),
			JwksUrl:              pulumi.String("https://idp.example.com/keys"),
			Scopes: pulumi.StringArray{
				pulumi.String("openid"),
			},
			TokenBinding:     pulumi.String("HTTP-POST"),
			TokenUrl:         pulumi.String("https://idp.example.com/token"),
			UserInfoBinding:  pulumi.String("HTTP-REDIRECT"),
			UserInfoUrl:      pulumi.String("https://idp.example.com/userinfo"),
			UsernameTemplate: pulumi.String("idpuser.email"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```
{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

## Import

An OIDC IdP can be imported via the Okta ID.

```sh
 $ pulumi import okta:idp/oidc:Oidc example <idp id>
```

accountLinkAction.description: Specifies the account linking action for an IdP user.

authorizationBinding.description: The method of making an authorization request. It can be set to `"HTTP-POST"` or `"HTTP-REDIRECT"`.

authorizationUrl.description: IdP Authorization Server (AS) endpoint to request consent from the user and obtain an authorization code grant.

clientId.description: Unique identifier issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

clientSecret.description: Client secret issued by AS for the Okta IdP instance.

deprovisionedAction.description: Action for a previously deprovisioned IdP user during authentication. Can be `"NONE"` or `"REACTIVATE"`.

groupsAction.description: Provisioning action for IdP user's group memberships. It can be `"NONE"`, `"SYNC"`, `"APPEND"`, or `"ASSIGN"`.

groupsAssignments.description: List of Okta Group IDs to add an IdP user as a member with the `"ASSIGN"` `groups_action`.

groupsAttribute.description: IdP user profile attribute name (case-insensitive) for an array value that contains group memberships.

groupsFilters.description: Whitelist of Okta Group identifiers that are allowed for the `"APPEND"` or `"SYNC"` `groups_action`.

issuerMode.description: Indicates whether Okta uses the original Okta org domain URL, or a custom domain URL. It can be `"ORG_URL"` or `"CUSTOM_URL"`.

jwksBinding.description: The method of making a request for the OIDC JWKS. It can be set to `"HTTP-POST"` or `"HTTP-REDIRECT"`.

jwksUrl.description: Endpoint where the signer of the keys publishes its keys in a JWK Set.

maxClockSkew.description: Maximum allowable clock-skew when processing messages from the IdP.

profileMaster.description: Determines if the IdP should act as a source of truth for user profile attributes.

okta:policy/ruleMfa:RuleMfa.description:
Creates an MFA Policy Rule.

This resource allows you to create and configure an MFA Policy Rule.


## Import

A Policy Rule can be imported via the Policy and Rule ID.

```sh
 $ pulumi import okta:policy/ruleMfa:RuleMfa example <policy id>/<rule id>
```

enroll.description: When a user should be prompted for MFA. It can be `"CHALLENGE"`, `"LOGIN"`, or `"NEVER"`.

networkConnection.description: Network selection mode: `"ANYWHERE"`, `"ZONE"`, `"ON_NETWORK"`, or `"OFF_NETWORK"`.

networkExcludes.description: The network zones to exclude. Conflicts with `network_includes`.

networkIncludes.description: The network zones to include. Conflicts with `network_excludes`.

priority.description: Policy Rule Priority, this attribute can be set to a valid priority. To avoid endless diff situation we error if an invalid priority is provided. API defaults it to the last/lowest if not there.

usersExcludeds.description: Set of User IDs to Exclude
